title: section 20 of the Taxi Regulation Acts 2013 and 2016 (No. 37 of 2013), hereby
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Small Public Service Vehicle
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Small Public Service Vehicle 
(Contingency Measure – Vehicle Supply) (Maximum Permissible Age) 
Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited small public service vehicle (contingency measure - vehicle supply) (maximum permissible age) regulation 2022

title: section 20 of the Taxi Regulation Acts 2013 and 2016 (No. 37 of 2013), hereby
heading: 2. The Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015
text_raw:
2. The Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015 
(S.I. No. 33 of 2015) are amended by substituting the following for Regulation 
31:- 

“Maximum permissible age requirements
text_norm: 2 taxi regulation (small public service vehicle) regulation 2015 (s.i no 33 2015) amended substituting following regulation 31 - maximum permissible age requirement

title: section 20 of the Taxi Regulation Acts 2013 and 2016 (No. 37 of 2013), hereby
heading: 31. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) the
text_raw:
31. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) the 

maximum permissible age of a— 

(a) 

standard taxi, standard hackney or local area hackney is ten 
years from the date of first registration of the vehicle, and 

(b) wheelchair accessible taxi or wheelchair accessible hackney is 
fifteen years from the date of first registration of the vehicle. 

(2) Subject to paragraphs (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) where a vehicle is 
associated with a standard taxi licence or standard hackney licence first 
granted before 1 January 2009 and was associated with such licence on 1 
January 2013, the maximum permissible age of such vehicle is fifteen years 
from the date of first registration of the vehicle. 

(3) This Regulation does not apply to limousines. 

(4) Notwithstanding anything in paragraphs (1) or (2), where a standard 
taxi, standard hackney, local area hackney, wheelchair accessible taxi or 
wheelchair accessible hackney would, by virtue of the time periods specified in 
paragraphs (1) or (2), have reached its maximum permissible age of ten years 
or fifteen years between 13 March 2020 and 31 December 2020, it shall not be 
deemed to have reached its maximum permissible age until a period of 60 
months after the date upon which it would have otherwise reached its 
maximum permissible age of ten years or fifteen years by virtue of the time 
periods specified in paragraphs (1) or (2). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 22nd November, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [588] 3 

(5) Notwithstanding anything in paragraphs (1) or (2), where a standard 
taxi, standard hackney, local area hackney, wheelchair accessible taxi or 
wheelchair accessible hackney would, by virtue of the time periods specified in 
paragraphs (1) or (2), have reached its maximum permissible age of ten years 
or fifteen years between 1 January 2021 and 31 December 2021, it shall not be 
deemed to have reached its maximum permissible age until a period of 48 
months after the date upon which it would have otherwise reached its 
maximum permissible age of ten years or fifteen years by virtue of the time 
periods specified in paragraphs (1) or (2). 

(6) Notwithstanding anything in paragraphs (1) or (2), where a standard 
taxi, standard hackney, local area hackney, wheelchair accessible taxi or 
wheelchair accessible hackney would, by virtue of the time periods specified in 
paragraphs (1) or (2), have reached its maximum permissible age of ten years 
or fifteen years between 1 January 2022 and 31 December 2022, it shall not be 
deemed to have reached its maximum permissible age until a period of 48 
months after the date upon which it would have otherwise reached its 
maximum permissible age of ten years or fifteen years by virtue of the time 
periods specified in paragraphs (1) or (2). 

(7) Notwithstanding anything in paragraphs (1) or (2), where a standard 
taxi, standard hackney, local area hackney, wheelchair accessible taxi or 
wheelchair accessible hackney would, by virtue of the time periods specified in 
paragraphs (1) or (2), have reached its maximum permissible age of ten years 
or fifteen years between 1 January 2023 and 31 December 2023 it shall not be 
deemed to have reached its maximum permissible age until a period of 36 
months after the date upon which it would have otherwise reached its 
maximum permissible age of ten years or fifteen years by virtue of the time 
periods specified in paragraphs (1) or (2). 

(8) Notwithstanding anything in paragraphs (1) or (2), where a standard 
taxi, standard hackney, local area hackney, wheelchair accessible taxi or 
wheelchair accessible hackney would, by virtue of the time periods specified in 
paragraphs (1) or (2), have reached its maximum permissible age of ten years 
or fifteen years between 1 January 2024 and 31 December 2024 it shall not be 
deemed to have reached its maximum permissible age until a period of 36 
months after the date upon which it would have otherwise reached its 
maximum permissible age of ten years or fifteen years by virtue of the time 
periods specified in paragraphs (1) or (2). 

(9) For the avoidance of doubt, the intention of paragraphs (4), (5), (6), (7) 
and (8) is to extend the maximum permissible age of the vehicles which would 
have reached their maximum permissible age in the periods mentioned in those 
paragraphs by a period of 60 months, 48 months, 48 months, 36 months and 36 
months respectively.”

title: section 20 of the Taxi Regulation Acts 2013 and 2016 (No. 37 of 2013), hereby
heading: 3. The Small Public Service Vehicle (Emergency Measure Covid-19)
text_raw:
3. The Small Public Service Vehicle (Emergency Measure Covid-19) 
(Maximum Permissible Age) Regulations 2021 (S. I. 482 of 2021) are revoked. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [588] 

GIVEN under the Seal of the National Transport Authority, 

18 November 2022. 

FRED BARRY, 

Chairperson, National Transport Authority. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [588] 5

title: section 20 of the Taxi Regulation Acts 2013 and 2016 (No. 37 of 2013), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to amend Regulation 31 of the Taxi 
Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015, Maximum 
Permissible Age Requirements and to revoke the Small Public Service Vehicle 
(Emergency Measure Covid-19) Regulations 2021 (S.I. 482 of 2021). This 
amendment is made as an exceptional provision and contingency measure 
resultant from current vehicle supply issues. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [588]
